properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place for the Marrickville Music Festival from 12.30am until midnight.

With large crowds expected traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area while closures and detours are in place. Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.  

Road closures:

  • Marrickville Road between Illawarra Road and Victoria Rd.
  • Gladstone Street between Marrickville Rd and Marrickville Ln
  • Silver Street between Marrickville Rd and Sydenham Rd
  • Garners Ave between Marrickville Rd and Sydenham Rd
  • Seymour Ln between Garners Ave and Frampton Ave
  • Garners Ln from Seymour Ln

From 9.30am to 6pm closures will be in place on Central Ln between Victoria Rd and Meeks Rd and Victoria Ln between Central Ln and unnamed lane off Meeks Rd.

More than 800 trucks and 900 motorbikes will form part of the annual i98 Illawarra convoy travelling from Appin and Bulli Tops to finish near Shellharbour Airport in Albion Park Rail. Motorbikes will leave from West Cliff Colliery, Appin from 8:15am, trucks will leave from Maddens Plains at 8.30am.

The convoy will travel via Appin Rd, Old Princes Hwy, M1 Princes Mwy, Masters Rd, Five Islands Rd, King St, Windang Rd, Shellharbour Rd, Lake Entrance Road, New Lake Entrance Rd and Princes Hwy. The convoy will finish at the Convoy shop, corner of Airport Rd and Princes Hwy, Albion Park Rail. Bikes will arrive from 9.15am and trucks from 10am.

Motorists may experience traffic delays along the convoy route. 

Speed reductions will be in effect at various times and locations between 4.30am and 3pm on sections of Appin Rd, M1 Princes Mwy and Princes Hwy.

The Old Princes Highway at Madden Plains will be closed between Helensburgh and Maddens Plains while trucks form up to participate in the convoy.

The right hand turn from Old Mount Ousley Rd onto the M1 Princes Mwy/Mount Ousley Rd will be closed between 7am and 12pm. The convoy will travel in one lane along the route. 

Motorists are advised to take care as they share roads with the convoy vehicles and allow extra travel time in the area while changed traffic conditions are in place.

roads.mainStreet: via Appin Road, Old Princes Highway, M1 Motorway,

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Sydney Kings v Illawarra Hawks at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 4pm, finish around 6:10pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Flume concert at The Dome, Sydney Showground. Start at 7pm, finish at 10pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with large volumes of rideshare and taxi movements.

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before.
Expect changed traffic conditions, including no parking zones, on the Great Western Highway.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
One Day International – Australia v England at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open from 1pm, ahead of play start from 2:20pm finish around 9:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in the area from 12pm until midnight including on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 12PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
The Coonamble White Ribbon Day March will take place on Friday 18th November between 9:30am and 10:00am.

The Castlereagh Hwy (Castlereagh St & Aberford St) will be closed between Namoi St and Wilga St. There is no suitable diversion available. All through traffic will be stopped and held whilst the event march takes place.

An event to celebrate Mendooran's 170th birthday will take place on Saturday 19 November between 10:00am and 3:00pm. Bandulla Street (Castlereagh Highway) will be closed between Napier Street and Yalcogran Street.

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Traffic will be detoured via Napier Street, Cobra Street and Yalcogran Street.

properties.otherAdvice:
Bathurst's Outdoor Expo and Christmas Markets will be taking place at the Bathurst Showground on Saturday 19th November and Sunday 20th November.

Changed traffic conditions will be in place including no parking zones on the Great Western Highway.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in event tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Super Cup: Everton FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm and full-time around 9:40pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

The following roads outside the stadium will close from full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue:

  • O’Connell Street from Grose Street to George Street
  • Ross Street from O’Connell Street to Trott Street
  • Victoria Road from O’Connell Street to Villiers Street

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose Street, Brickfield Street, Victoria Road and Wilde Avenue in both directions.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Country Classic Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates Open: 11:45am First race at 12:40pm, last race at 6:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains and express services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Super Cup - Celtic FC v Everton FC at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Kick off from 2.45pm, finish around 4.40pm.

With more than 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Super Cup - Celtic FC v Sydney FC at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5.15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax grass car park will not be open for the event.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in the area from 3pm until 11pm including on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Guns N' Roses concert at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Support acts start from 5.30pm, concert finish around 10.30pm.

With more than 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct.

properties.otherAdvice:
Matildas v Thailand at Central Coast Stadium (Industree Group Stadium). Game starts at 7:30pm, finish around 9:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

Up to 160 cyclists will take part in The Bondi2Berry 155km ride from Bondi Beach at 6am to Berry on the South Coast by 2:30pm.

Road closures will not be in place however motorists should exercise caution as they share roads with cyclists during the event.

The group will leave Bondi at 6am travelling via Bondi Rd, Darley Rd, South Dowling St, General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Rocky Point Rd, Taren Point Rd, The Kingsway and the Princes Hwy through the Royal National Park to Stanwell Tops.

Cyclists will then continue along the coast via Otford Rd, Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Grand Pacific Dr, Princes Hwy, Memorial Dr and Squires Way into Wollongong. From there, cyclists will travel via Windang Rd and the Princes Hwy to Kiama before the last leg of the ride to Berry via Crooked River Rd, Beach Rd and Queen St.

Motorists may experience some delays along the cycle route particularly on Lawrence Hargrave Drive from Stanwell Park to Thirroul and the Princes Hwy at Bulli as they share roads with cyclists. Allow extra time and exercise caution. 

Drivers are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under

roads.mainStreet: via General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Kingsway, Princes Hwy, Lawrence Hargrave Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Good Things Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

With more than 20,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will close from 9pm until 11:30pm to allow festivalgoers to safely leave the area.

Motorists driving in the area should allow extra travel time.

Special event clearways will also be in place from 11am until 11pm on key roads in Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
The following roads will be closed in Centennial Park and Moore Park:

FROM 9PM TO 11:30PM

  • ​​Driver Avenue between ​Lang Road​ and ​the southern turning circle​ (both directions)
  • ​​Lang Road between Anzac Parade and ​Errol Flynn Boulevard (both directions)
  • Lang Road between ​Moore Park Road​ and ​Mitchell Street (both directions)
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Lang Road (westbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Oatley Road and Regent Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road* between Regent Street and Gordon Street (eastbound)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Oxford Street (eastbound)

*Managed access to/from the Entertainment Quarter

properties.otherAdvice:
There will be changed traffic conditions at a number of locations from 5am on Sunday 20 November for the Kingscliff Triathlon.


The Pacific Motorway will be impacted around Kingscliff;

  • If travelling north, alternate access to Fingal Head will be via Waugh Street
  • If travelling south, alternate access to Kingscliff will be via Tweed Coast Road

Local road closures include;

  • Chinderah Bay Drive
  • Marine Parade
  • Wommin Bay Road
  • Cudgen Creek boat access ramp
  • Moss Street
  • Sutherland Point Road

Signage will be in place on the day including variable message boards and detour signage. Please follow the signage in place and drive with caution.
properties.diversions:
The Pacific Motorway will be impacted around Kingscliff;

  • If travelling north, alternate access to Fingal Head will be via Waugh Street
  • If travelling south, alternate access to Kingscliff will be via Tweed Coast Road

Check the event website for a full list of impacted local roads https://kingsclifftri.org/roads/
